giveaway noun [C]
(TRUTH)
informal something that tells or shows something secret, often without intending to: a dead giveaway He said he'd given up smoking, but the empty packs in the bin were a dead giveaway (= clearly showed the secret truth).

giveaway noun [C]
(SPORT)
a situation in a game such as football or ice hockey when a player's actions cause the ball, puck, or a point to be lost to another player or the other team: a giveaway goal They chased the ball all over the field and pressured opponents into giveaways.
More examplesFewer examplesHis goal came after a giveaway from a poor kick by James.The giveaways weren't the only disappointments for the team.Her second double-fault giveaway breathed new life into her opponent.
